ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it to a fellow student, although I would advise that the student should be fairly comfortable working outside of his/her field and would be better off if he/she already had some familiarity with Political Science.
Yes, I would recommend it. It was a very interesting course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course provided me with a great deal of raw information about the Progressive Era, the New Deal, and the Great Society. On a very basic level, I learned a lot.On a slightly higher level, I feel like I am much more interested in politics qua politics much more than I was before, and I can see it playing a much larger role in my future research than I had previously anticipated.

This is the first time I've taken a course in American politics / American political theory, so it was mostly new to me. However, I was astonished by the amount of overlap between (particularly) early 20th century American political thought and the areas of Continental philosophy that I study (particularly German theories of state and legitimacy).
